intro: Neohyptis, commonly known as blue hyptis, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Lamiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plants are characterized by their aromatic leaves and showy, often violet or blue flowers. Neohyptis species typically grow as shrubs or subshrubs, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. They are often used in traditional medicine and as ornamental plants due to their attractive appearance and pleasant fragrance.
